# Classification Rule

**True if:** The text contains at least one word that appears to be random/gibberish (non-dictionary words with unusual letter combinations like "eum", "hjnz", "xidd", "akoa", "obyc", etc.)

**False if:** The text contains only recognizable English dictionary words (like "python", "testing", "sample", "hello", "example", "lazy", etc.)

In other words: **Classify as True when gibberish/random strings are present; False when only real English words are used.**
